title: [K-12] Designing Explicit/Implicit Teaching Strategies for Perceptual Sequence Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic cognitive science theories and language processing mechanisms
context.additional_context: Professional development program through language pattern recognition in digital environments

learning_goals: Learners can analyze the effectiveness difference between explicit/implicit instructions in perceptual sequence learning tasks with 80% accuracy.
Learners can develop and evaluate sequential recognition strategies through color-response mapping experiments.
Learners can diagnose learning strategies with 70% reliability using the Process-Discrete Procedure (PDP).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
